div.div: θρόνος : arm-chair, with high back and foot - stool; cushions were laid upon the seat, and over both seat and back rugs were spread. (See cut, under ἄμπυξ. Cf. also Nos. 105, 106, where two chairs, from Assyrian and Greek originals, are represented.)
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
